MINUTES AND OFFICIAL NOTES
(1) As a rule, minutes of probate proceedings shall be taken.
(2) An official note instead of minutes may be put on the record in the case of less important statements of the parties and information gathered by the court.
(3) The minutes shall be signed by the parties present at the proceedings, the judge, and the recording clerk or referee who took the minutes.
(4) An official note on a record shall be signed by the person who composed it.
